column4: Curious question.. If I have just installed pulseaudio and I can see the audio output on the volume meter on padevchooser, but still no sound did i do something wrong?
turn up the volume. Next!
then we shall investigate further.
what sound card do you have?
ok, and you are getting indications that the output is indeed happening?
ah, that's why I mentioned a usability/resource tradeoff. But yes, ICEwm is up there.
anyway, look at alsamixer. See if that has muted you
you look at alsamixer yet?
The first thing I did when I installed ubuntu. no mutes and all volumes are up.
ok. That's the easy things out of the way. Let's get deeper :)
yay... =p
you've probably already looked, but what's the entry for your soundcard when you do "lspci -v"?
00:1e.2 Multimedia audio controller: Intel Corporation 82801FB/FBM/FR/FW/FRW (ICH6 Family) AC'97 Audio Controller (rev 03)
ok, I can't remember a problem with that controller offhand ... what about "aplay -l" , what does that give you?
ok, we know it is set to the right playback device ...
and you've looked at your amixer settings ("amixer | less") and all the settings look cool, right?
All of those are fine.
and "asoundconf list" shows the same soundcard I'm guessing?
ok, do a quick "speaker-test" to make sure it's not the app you are using
speaker-test doesn't work either?
nothing.
